For those of you who can`t start the campaign, make sure you click human and episode one (like you would select them). The play button will be pressable. Then you will get a black screen and nothing will happen. Just alt-tab, and alt-tab again back to the game. It should start in a couple of seconds.
You`re welcome

Once the screen turned black I just had to wait for ~45 seconds for the loading screen to slowly appear. Don't alt-tab or anything, just sit for a minute and let it catch it's breath.

In other news don't even waste your time downloading this half finished game. I got through the first two campaign missions (barely) and regretted wasting my time.

I really hope they will update the game with future patches. It has great potential, but honestly feels like an internal alpha build of the game. Go onto the Steam forums and you'll see what I'm talking about.

Thanks for the great upload though!

Just a fair warning to all the people getting this: The game is horribly broken and has many problems. Not because of this torrent, but because the people that made it released it in an unfinished state. 

Me, along with many other user reviewers on several websites, agree that the game is currently unplayable and will need many patches and fixes before it's worth playing.

Broken Menu Buttons, Frequent Black Screens, no Graphic Options except for Resolution, and poor UI Design plagues this game currently.

People are being hateful here just because someone says it doesn't work. Well, it isn't working for me either. Instead of calling me an idiot, maybe someone with some REAL knowledge could be of assistance. I am sure it must have something to do with the variety of OS's and other environmental elements. I am windows XP. First it wouldn't work due to a .dll file missing. I found it in the redist. cab and extracted it to the game directory. On that attempt, it said it wasn't a valid game file. So, even though I use net frame 4, and am newer with the C++, etc., I reinstalled and opted to have those items installed (figuring perhaps the .dll and other things needed to be extracted during installation to work). Installation proceeded to tell me I had newer versions of all this stuff on my pc and those parts failed to install. But, when, this time, I copied the SKIDROW folder items to the main installed directory, the game tried to start without saying anything was missing. However, after a moment of a black screen fading and darkening, the error message says the game encountered and error and must close. It doesn't say what kind of error, and it always happens. Now, if you want to call me stupid just because it happens to work on your machine, you must be about 15 years old. Is there anyone out there with some experience in this?
